intro: Tarenaya horrida, commonly known as the horrid tarenaya, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Tarenaya horrida is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and gravelly areas.
